## âœ… Code Quality Checklist

### General
- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines (see CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors
- [ ] I have removed any debugging code (console.logs, debuggers, etc.)

### Testing
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested edge cases and error scenarios
- [ ] I have verified backward compatibility (if applicable)

### Security
- [ ] I have not committed any sensitive information (API keys, passwords, etc.)
- [ ] I have validated and sanitized all user inputs
- [ ] I have followed secure coding practices
- [ ] I have considered potential security implications of my changes
- [ ] I have updated .env.example if new environment variables are needed

### Performance
- [ ] I have considered the performance impact of my changes
- [ ] I have optimized database queries (if applicable)
- [ ] I have avoided unnecessary API calls or re-renders
- [ ] I have tested with realistic data volumes

### Accessibility
- [ ] I have tested keyboard navigation (if UI changes)
- [ ] I have added appropriate ARIA labels (if applicable)
- [ ] I have ensured proper color contrast (if UI changes)
- [ ] I have tested with screen readers (if applicable)
